If there are afflictions that cannot benefit others, and that cannot be aroused in order to fulfill the factors of enlightenment, they are not in accord with meaning and benefit, and are not in accord with the Dharma, but are only causes for inferior wholesome roots.

There are other bodhisattvas who, due to the power of their wisdom, are able to directly perceive the afflictions.

Therefore, you should deeply believe in the skillful means and practices of all bodhisattvas.
Why is this?
Because the practices of skillful means by bodhisattvas who practice with wisdom are difficult to believe and understand.
Maitreya!
It is like a stream-enterer showing the conduct of ordinary beings.
Thus, there is a distinction between the stage of ordinary beings and the stage of stream-enterers.

Ordinary foolish people, due to being bound by greed, anger, and delusion, fall into the evil destinies, but stream-enterers are able to understand greed, anger, and delusion well, and will never fall into the three evil destinies.
Maitreya!
The bodhisattvas of wisdom practice are also like this. Even if the habits of greed, anger, and delusion have not yet been severed, they are still different from other beginner bodhisattvas.
Why is this?
Their minds are not covered by afflictions, unlike the beginner bodhisattvas.
The bodhisattvas of dull practice lack skillful means and are the same as ordinary beings, unable to escape.
Maitreya!
The bodhisattvas of wisdom practice, all grave offenses, are able to destroy them all with the power of wisdom, and also do not fall into evil destinies because of them.
Maitreya!
It is like a person who throws firewood into a great mass of fire and adds to it again and again.
After adding in this way, the flames become more and more radiant and do not cease.
Maitreya!
The bodhisattva of wisdom practice is also like this. The fire of wisdom burns the firewood of afflictions, and repeatedly adds the firewood of afflictions.
After adding in this way, the fire of wisdom becomes even more radiant and does not cease.
